    • Method Detail

      • cleanAlgorithm

        protected void cleanAlgorithm()
        Description copied from class: AbstractAlgorithm
        This is the local clean algorithm, as referred to by the global clean() method. This method should be implemented in each Algorithm. The clean() method, and thus cleanAlgorithm() as well, is called first when running an Algorithm
        Specified by:
        cleanAlgorithm in class AbstractAlgorithm

      • preprocess

        public void preprocess()
        Description copied from class: AbstractAlgorithm
        The preprocess method is called after cleaning is performed and can be used to do some costly data preprocessing that does not have to be repeated over multiple runs. For instance, you can usually already extract the textual features from all pieces of text and store them in features, as these normally do not change over different runs.
        Specified by:
        preprocess in class AbstractAlgorithm

      • train

        public void train()
        Description copied from class: AbstractAlgorithm
        The train method is called after preprocessing and is used to train your Algorithm. Here, you can use the gold standard annotation to tune paramters, train machine learning models, etc. This method is repeated everytime the Algorithm is run. Variables resulting from this method, like the trained model or parameters, have to be cleaned first to ensure valid results.
        Specified by:
        train in class AbstractAlgorithm

      • predict

        public void predict()
        Description copied from class: AbstractAlgorithm
        The predict method uses the trained model or tuned parameters from the train method to make predictions on previously unseen data. Your implementation should create Prediction objects which should be stored in the prediction map as the evaluation method will look there for your results.
        Specified by:
        predict in class AbstractAlgorithm
